Historical

Biography

2023 NCAA Outdoor 1,500m Champion

2023 All-Pac-12 First Team Cross Country

2023 All-West Region Cross Country

2023 Pac-12 1,500m Champion

2023 All-America First Team (1,500m, Outdoors | Mile and DMR, Indoors)

2022 All-America First Team (1,500m, Outdoors)

2022 U.S. Junior 1,500m Champion

Green Features

» Husky Teamwork Pulls Washington Milers Forward (Track & Field News; Apr. 3, 2024)

» Washington's Freshman All-American Eager To Have First International Track Experience In Colombia (Runnerspace; July 26, 2022)

2023-24 (Cross Country): Raced just twice in the fall but made the most of each race, placing third overall at the Pac-12 Cross Country Championships and leading UW at West Regionals … first race of the season came at Pac-12s and he kicked to third-place in 22:56, helping the Huskies finish second as a team ... at West Regionals, in his first career 10k, led the team in 17th-place overall in 29:40 to earn All-West Region honors … earned a spot on the Pac-12 Fall Academic Honor Roll … named to the USTFCCCA All-Academic Team.

2022-23 (Track): Captured the national championship at 1,500-meters outdoors, becoming the third-different Husky to win three consecutive NCAA mile or 1,500-meter titles ... took the NCAA title with a powerful kick to cross the line in 3:42.78, with teammate Joe Waskom taking second-place for the first 1-2 finish in the event by teammates since 2011 ... at his first USATF Outdoor Championships, ran consecutive PRs, making the final with a prelim time of 3:37.03, and then placed seventh in the final in 3:36.29 ... won his first Pac-12 Championship in the 1,500-meters as UW won its first ever team title, pulling away for the win in 3:42.22 … ran a season-best 1,500m time of 3:38.13 in the NCAA Prelim quarterfinals, the top time at Prelims … did not start outdoor season until the Pac-12 meet … indoors, one of four Huskies to make the NCAA Indoor mile final, placing fifth in the final for First Team All-America honors … also ran the 800m leg on the DMR at NCAA Indoors, helping the team take fourth for another First Team All-America … twice was part of UW’s historic eight-man sub-four mile races, first running 3:52.76 at the UW Invitational where he was third, then running 3:53.25 at the BU Last Chance Qualifier … 3:52.76 time ranks fourth in school history … broke the 800-meter indoor School Record at the Husky Classic, running 1:46.99 … opened his track season with his first career sub-four-minute mile, going 3:58.27 at the UW Indoor Preview ... (Cross Country): Raced at the first meet of the season, placing 131st overall at the Cowboy Jamboree and sixth on the team, in 25:04.

2021-22 (Track): A record-breaking and All-American freshman outdoor season on the track, as he scored in the NCAA Outdoor Championship 1,500-meters final and then went on to win the U.S. U20 Championship … at his first NCAAs, was one of three Huskies to reach the 1,500-meters final, where he placed seventh in 3:46.26 to earn First Team All-America honors, as teammate Joe Waskom got the win and Luke Houser placed fifth … in the NCAA semifinals, he broke the school record with a time of 3:37.46 … won the U.S. U20 1,500m title with a big kick to pull away in 3:45.19 … qualified for Team USA to race at the World U20 Championships in Cali, Colombia, where he finished fifth in the finals … at the Pac-12 Championships, made the final of the 800-meters, placing fifth in 1:50.50 … clocked his first sub-3:40 1,500m at the Bryan Clay Invitational, going 3:39.63 … first race as a Dawg was at the Raleigh Relays, where he ran 3:41.37 … won the 800-meters at the UW-WSU Dual in 1:50.24 … did not compete indoors ... named to the USTFCCCA All-Academic Team ... (Cross Country): Redshirted the fall season.

High School and Personal: Born in Billings, Montana … mother is April Nezirevic and stepfather Admir Nezirevic, father is Patrick Green … has two older siblings, Taylor and Alexa, and two younger, Hudson and Cullen … one of the top recruits in the country, rated the No. 1 recruit in the nation by MileSplit.com … a five-time Gatorade Idaho Athlete of the Year, three times in cross country and two times in track and field … a nine-time Idaho State Champion … undefeated in all individual track events in 2021 … set the Brooks PR Invite mile record in 2021 with a time of 4:01.76 … just 24 hours after the Brooks PR win in Renton, Wash., traveled to Hayward Field in Eugene and won the Nike Outdoor Nationals mile title for two national mile wins in two days … set a mile PR of 4:00.97 at 2,700-feet at the 2021 YMCA Invitational in Boise, the No. 1 fastest mile time by a high school athlete in 2021 … twice placed top-20 at Nike Cross Nationals, including an 11th-place finish as a junior when he was the top junior finisher; event canceled his senior year due to the pandemic … Idaho state record-holder in the mile, two-mile, 5,000-meters, and course record-holder at two state championship courses … hobbies include fishing and playing the guitar.

Major Meets

2022 Pac-12 TF - 5th, 800m | 9th, 4x400m

2022 NCAA Prelims TF - 12th, 1500m

2022 NCAA Outdoors - 7th, 1500m (All-America First Team)

2022 USA U20 Championships - 1st, 1500m (U.S. U20 Champion)

2022 World U20 Championships - 5th, 1500m

2023 NCAA Indoors - 5th, Mile (All-America First Team) | 4th, DMR (All-America First Team)

2023 Pac-12 TF - 1st, 1500m (Pac-12 Champion)

2023 NCAA Prelims TF - 1st, 1500m

2023 NCAA Outdoors - 1st, 1500m (NCAA Champion; First Team All-America)

2023 USA Outdoors - 7th, 1500m

2023 Pac-12 XC - 3rd (2nd UW)

2023 Regional XC - 17th (1st UW)

Outdoor Bests

800m.......1:49.38

1500m.......3:36.29

Indoor Bests
